column2: No men stopped us, for there were none about [-from-] the Palace of Corrective Detention, and the others knew nothing.
column3: No men stopped us, for there were none about [-from ] the Palace of Corrective Detention, and the others knew nothing.

column2: We saw nothing as we entered, save the sky in the great windows, blue and glowing.
column3: We saw nothing as we entered, save the sky in the great windows, blue and glowing.

column2: All the heads of the Council turned to us as we entered.
column3: All the heads of the Council turned to us as we entered.

column2: These great and wise of the earth did not know what to think of us, and they looked upon us with wonder and curiosity, as if we were a miracle.
column3: These great and wise of the earth did not know what to think of us, and they looked upon us with wonder and curiosity, as if we were a miracle.

column2: It is true that our tunic was torn and stained with brown stains which had been blood.
column3: It is true that our tunic was torn and stained with brown stains which had been blood.

column2: Who are you, our brother?	Who are you, our brother?
A Street Sweeper!	A Street Sweeper!
It is not to be believed!
column3: It is not to be believed!

column2: Our brothers! we said.
column3: Our brothers! we said.

column2: We spoke of it, and of our long quest, and of our tunnel, and of our escape from the Palace of Corrective Detention.
column3: We spoke of it, and of our long quest, and of our tunnel, and of our escape from the Palace of Corrective Detention.

column2: And we stood still, our eyes upon the wire.
column3: And we stood still, our eyes upon the wire.

column2: And slowly, slowly as a flush of blood, a red flame trembled in the wire.
column3: And slowly, slowly as a flush of blood, a red flame trembled in the wire.

column2: Then the wire glowed.
column3: Then the wire glowed.

column2: But terror struck the men of the Council.
column3: But terror struck the men of the Council.

column2: We looked upon them and we laughed and said:
column3: We looked upon them and we laughed and said:

column2: Fear nothing, our brothers.	Fear nothing, our brothers.
We give it to you."
column3: We give it to you."

column2: Still they would not move.
column3: Still they would not move.

column2: We give you the power of the sky! we cried.
column3: We give you the power of the sky! we cried.

column2: We give you the key to the earth!	We give you the key to the earth!
Take it, and let us be one of you, the humblest among you.
column3: Take it, and let us be one of you, the humblest among you.

column2: Let us [-all-] work together, and harness this power, and make it ease the toil of men.
column3: Let us [-all ] work together, and harness this power, and make it ease the toil of men.

column2: Let us throw away our candles and our torches.
column3: Let us throw away our candles and our torches.

column2: Let us bring a new light to men!"
column3: Let us bring a new light to men!"

column2: But they looked upon us, and suddenly we were afraid.
column3: But they looked upon us, and suddenly we were afraid.

column2: For their eyes were still, and small, and evil.
column3: For their eyes were still, and small, and evil.

column2: They moved to the table and the others followed.
column3: They moved to the table and the others followed.

column2: No such crime has ever been committed, and it is not for us to judge.
column3: No such crime has ever been committed, and it is not for us to judge.

column2: Nor for any small Council.
column3: Nor for any small Council.

column2: We looked upon them and we pleaded:
column3: We looked upon them and we pleaded:

column2: Our brothers!	Our brothers!
You are right.
column3: You are right.

column2: We do not care.
column3: We do not care.

column2: What will you do with the light?"
column3: What will you do with the light?"

column2: No, we answered.
column3: No, we answered.

column2: Therefore it cannot be destroyed by the whim of one."
column3: Therefore it cannot be destroyed by the whim of one."

column2: This thing, they said, "must be destroyed."
column3: This thing, they said, "must be destroyed."

column2: And all the others cried as one:
column3: And all the others cried as one:

column2: It must be destroyed!
column3: It must be destroyed!

column2: We turned and we looked at them for the last time, and a rage, such as [-it-] is not fit for humans to know, choked our voice in our throat.
column3: We turned and we looked at them for the last time, and a rage, such as [-it ] is not fit for humans to know, choked our voice in our throat.

column2: You fools!	You fools!
You thrice-damned fools!"
column3: You thrice damned fools!"

column2: We fell, but we never let the box fall from our hands.
column3: We fell, but we never let the box fall from our hands.

column2: And the road seemed not to be flat before us, but as if it were leaping up to meet us, and we waited for the earth to rise and strike us in the face.
column3: And the road seemed not to be flat before us, but as if it were leaping up to meet us, and we waited for the earth to rise and strike us in the face.

column2: But we ran.
column3: But we ran.

column2: We knew not where we were going.
column3: We knew not where we were going.

column2: Then we knew suddenly that we were lying on a soft earth and that we had stopped.
column3: Then we knew suddenly that we were lying on a soft earth and that we had stopped.

column2: We had not thought of coming here, but our legs had carried our wisdom, and our legs had brought us to the Uncharted Forest against our will.
column3: We had not thought of coming here, but our legs had carried our wisdom, and our legs had brought us to the Uncharted Forest against our will.

column2: Our glass box lay beside us.
column3: Our glass box lay beside us.

column2: We crawled to it, we fell upon it, our face in our arms, and we lay still.
column3: We crawled to it, we fell upon it, our face in our arms, and we lay still.

column2: It mattered not where we went.
column3: It mattered not where we went.

column2: The forest disposes of its own victims.
column3: The forest disposes of its own victims.

column2: This gave us no fear either.
column3: This gave us no fear either.

column2: So we walked on, our box in our arms, our heart empty.
column3: So we walked on, our box in our arms, our heart empty.

column2: Whatever days are left to us, we shall spend them alone.
column3: Whatever days are left to us, we shall spend them alone.

column2: And we have heard of the corruption to be found in solitude.
column3: And we have heard of the corruption to be found in solitude.

column2: We know these things, but we do not care.
column3: We know these things, but we do not care.

column2: We are tired.
column3: We are tired.

column2: Only the glass box in our arms is like a living heart that gives us strength.
column3: Only the glass box in our arms is like a living heart that gives us strength.

column2: We built it for its own sake. It is above all our brothers to us, and its truth above their truth.
column3: We built it for its own sake. It is above all our brothers to us, and its truth above their truth.

column2: Why wonder about this?
column3: Why wonder about this?
